server

Class DictionaryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.DictionaryManager

  • public class DictionaryManager
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DictionaryManager()
      The DictionaryManager function is used to add new dictionaries only as needed and will provide the answers of the appropriate dictionaries.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean challenge(java.lang.String... args)
      The query function takes a variable number of arguments, the list of books with the last argument being the word to search for.
      static DictionaryManager get()
      The get function is a static function that returns the singleton instance of the DictionaryManager class.
      int getSize()
      The getSize function returns the size of the map.
      boolean query(java.lang.String... args)
      The query function takes a variable number of arguments, the list of books with the last argument being the word to search for.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DictionaryManager

        public DictionaryManager()
        The DictionaryManager function is used to add new dictionaries only as needed and will provide the answers of the appropriate dictionaries.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static DictionaryManager get()
        The get function is a static function that returns the singleton instance of the DictionaryManager class. If no instance exists, it creates one and then returns it.
        Returns:
        The dictionarymanager object

      • query

        public boolean query(java.lang.String... args)
        The query function takes a variable number of arguments, the list of books with the last argument being the word to search for. The function then searches each book to see if it contains the word. If any book is not in the map, we create a value for it and add its dictionary to our map. Then we look for a way in the dictionary of this new book the word. If at any point we discover that one of these dictionaries contains our word, we will return true.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments that display the list of books so that the last argument is the word to search for
        Returns:
        True if the word is found in any of the books, false otherwise

      • challenge

        public boolean challenge(java.lang.String... args)
        The query function takes a variable number of arguments, the list of books with the last argument being the word to search for. The function then searches each book to see if it contains the word. If any book is not in the map, we create a value for it and add its dictionary to our map. Then we look for a way in the dictionary of this new book the word. If at any point we discover that one of these dictionaries contains our word, we will return true.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments that display the list of books so that the last argument is the word to search for
        Returns:
        True if the word is found in any of the books, false otherwise

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        The getSize function returns the size of the map.
        Returns:
        The size of the map
